channel.title: Pausing?
channel.description: Hey um i am making a music player, not very far into it and it wont be very efficient because scar only reads .wav files but im trying to get it to 'pause' and 'stop' the music any ideas?

item.title: Pausing?
item.dc:creator: @script_owned4 script_owned4
item.description:
@script_owned4 wrote:

The Un-Named:

[quote author=script_owned4 link=topic=221258.msg1915699#msg1915699 date=1196913609]which probably only advanced SRL develepors can do , like Fawki.

Actually, Delphi has pretty good support for music players so any fool with half a brain can write a music player using a plugin.[/quote]
But he was talking about SCAR not Delphi.

And your right Delphi does support music players, but SCAR doesn’t.

Read full topic

item.title: Pausing?

item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

script_owned4:

which probably only advanced SRL develepors can do , like Fawki.

Actually, Delphi has pretty good support for music players so any fool with half a brain can write a music player using a plugin.

Use dephi? It’s basically the same language so you won’t have to relearn it.

item.title: Pausing?
item.dc:creator: @script_owned4 script_owned4
item.description:
@script_owned4 wrote:

Not being rude -

The Un-Named and Nashi are right, they hardly have any music capabilities, so making an i-pod is like making a plugin to SCAR for the music to be shown, which probably only advanced SRL develepors can do , like Fawki.

Here is one I know of:

(Got from the free scripts on SCAR):

program New; begin PlaySound('E:\MP3\Metals vieglais un smagais\Power Metal\Kamelot\Epica\13_Helena''s Theme.mp3'); Sleep(1000); PlaySound('C:\WINDOWS\Media\Windows XP Shutdown.wav'); end.

Read full topic

yeah i guess so…
im just not really willing to learn another language, i guess java would be O.K but it will take a while to reach GUI’s.

item.description:

SCAR has very limited capabilities with anything that can’t help you auto.
